014package org.jdbi.v3.commonstext;
015
016import java.util.function.Consumer;
017
018import org.apache.commons.text.StringSubstitutor;
019import org.jdbi.v3.core.statement.StatementContext;
020import org.jdbi.v3.core.statement.TemplateEngine;
021
022/**
023 * Register an instance of this class ({@link org.jdbi.v3.core.statement.SqlStatements#setTemplateEngine}) to use an Apache Commons Text {@link StringSubstitutor} as a {@link TemplateEngine}. This lets you use any pair of strings as variable delimiters, enabling the use of syntax like <pre>select * from ${foo}</pre>, <pre>select * from &lt;foo&gt;</pre>, <pre>select * from %foo%</pre>, etc.
024 */
025public class StringSubstitutorTemplateEngine implements TemplateEngine {
026    static final String DEFAULT_PREFIX = "${";
027    static final String DEFAULT_SUFFIX = "}";
028    static final char DEFAULT_ESCAPE = '\\';
029
030    private final Consumer<StringSubstitutor> customizer;
031
032    /**
033     * Default is <pre>${foo}</pre> syntax.
034     */
035    public StringSubstitutorTemplateEngine() {
036        this(substitutor -> {
037            substitutor.setVariablePrefix(DEFAULT_PREFIX);
038            substitutor.setVariableSuffix(DEFAULT_SUFFIX);
039            substitutor.setEscapeChar(DEFAULT_ESCAPE);
040        });
041    }
042
043    /**
044     * Customize the given {@link StringSubstitutor} instance to set your preferred prefix, suffix, escape character, and perhaps other configuration. The instance is created by Jdbi, and is not shared nor re-used. Your customizer function however will be re-used for all instances.
045     */
046    public StringSubstitutorTemplateEngine(Consumer<StringSubstitutor> customizer) {
047        this.customizer = customizer;
048    }
049
050    @Override
051    public String render(String template, StatementContext ctx) {
052        StringSubstitutor substitutor = new StringSubstitutor(ctx.getAttributes());
053        customizer.accept(substitutor);
054        return substitutor.replace(template);
055    }
056
057    public static StringSubstitutorTemplateEngine between(char prefix, char suffix) {
058        return new StringSubstitutorTemplateEngine(substitutor -> {
059            substitutor.setVariablePrefix(prefix);
060            substitutor.setVariableSuffix(suffix);
061        });
062    }
063
064    public static StringSubstitutorTemplateEngine between(String prefix, String suffix) {
065        return new StringSubstitutorTemplateEngine(substitutor -> {
066            substitutor.setVariablePrefix(prefix);
067            substitutor.setVariableSuffix(suffix);
068        });
069    }
070
071    public static StringSubstitutorTemplateEngine between(char prefix, char suffix, char escape) {
072        return new StringSubstitutorTemplateEngine(substitutor -> {
073            substitutor.setVariablePrefix(prefix);
074            substitutor.setVariableSuffix(suffix);
075            substitutor.setEscapeChar(escape);
076        });
077    }
078
079    public static StringSubstitutorTemplateEngine between(String prefix, String suffix, char escape) {
080        return new StringSubstitutorTemplateEngine(substitutor -> {
081            substitutor.setVariablePrefix(prefix);
082            substitutor.setVariableSuffix(suffix);
083            substitutor.setEscapeChar(escape);
084        });
085    }
086}
